New Records: Quinton de Kock's half-century off 22 balls has equalled the fastest fifty of the tournament
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took a catch over his right shoulder to dismiss Harry Brook
Aiden Markram took a catch to dismiss Jos Buttler
Reece Topley dismissed Quinton de Kock
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa has included just one spinner: Keshav Maharaj, and may turn to Aiden Markram at some stage
England have made some strong gains in net run-rate
The DJ is blaring out Fred Again over the speakers but the only people listening are the players, event staff and a handful of journalists
The problem is Rassie van der Dussen, who top-scored with 94* in the last meeting, is not in South Africa's squad
Post-Match Reflections: Props have to go to Quinton de Kock, who set them up so well, and to Keshav Maharaj, for controlling the mid-section of the innings, to Anrich Nortje for bowling a good final over and to Aiden Markram for a second clutch catch in this tournament
England by no means out of things. They came close and their NRR remains positive. They play USA and a win there should see them through to the semis.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Harry Brook brought up his first World Cup fifty off 35 balls
Bairstow was run out by Buttler's golden arm
De Kock's 49 runs in the Powerplay are the most by a SA batter at a Men's T20 World Cup
Others: The DJ is blaring out Fred Again over the speakers but the only people listening are the players, event staff and a handful of journalists
